Key Match Events: Minnesota squandered the best start of rookie David Festa’s young career.
The Twins had a baserunning out at home and a two-run double off Manuel Margot’s glove in left field.
The Twins’ fourth consecutive loss and eighth in their past 10 games pushed their deficit in the AL Central to 3 1/2 games behind the first-place Guardians.
The Twins got better looks against Braves starter Chris Sale but only managed to score one run.
Margot was thrown out at home by a huge margin on Ryan Jeffers’ single.
The Twins erased their 1-0 deficit thanks to a single by Jose Miranda and a game-tying knock by Willi Castro.
The Braves answered with a four-run rally in the seventh inning.
Caleb Thielbar allowed a go-ahead double to Matt Olson.
Luke Williams hit a two-run double off Margot’s glove, putting the game out of reach.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Rocco Baldelli emphasized the need for the team to play better and avoid mistakes.
Margot expressed surprise at being given the green light to run home and took responsibility for not making a key play in the outfield.
Baldelli backed third-base coach Tommy Watkins despite the controversial decision to send Margot home.
Baldelli acknowledged the team's recent struggles and the need to overcome mistakes to win games.
